TMDA Donations

Like most open source projects, TMDA is developed and supported entirely by the unpaid and free hours of hackers and users from all over the globe. It's entirely a volunteer effort. TMDA is completely free, and you are not obligated to offer anything at all in return for it, but often users prefer to give back in some manner.

Typically, TMDA donations come in the form of valuable non-financial contributions such as code, documentation, and advocacy, but the option of a monetary donation is now available as well. Your financial contribution will be used only to further the project. It will not be used for the personal needs of any TMDA developer or user.

Examples of how your donation might be used:
  • Help pay the monthly hosting charge for the tmda.net server.
  • Pay a free-lance developer to implement an important new TMDA capability.
  • Fund the first annual TMDA developer/user retreat and wild turkey hunt.
Examples of how your donation will not be used:
  • Help expand Jason's single malt scotch collection.
If you feel TMDA has been useful to yourself or your organization and would like to make a donation, click on the button below to pay by credit card. Please indicate in the comments section whether you would like to be publicly acknowledged as a TMDA donor, or remain anonymous.

If you'd prefer to not get involved with PayPal and would like to donate via check, money order, or wire transfer instead, please contact me with the details.
